content:
Agreement No.
AGREEMENT
This agreement, made and entered into as of 15 November 1961 by and between Catholic Relief Services-N.C.W.C., Taipei (date signed)
(name of voluntary agency)
(name of institution (hereinafter referred to as the Supplier) and the St. Camillus Hospital
located at 14 Hsute Road Makung Penghu
or agency) (address of institution or agency) as represented by Rev. Aldus Antonelli (name of institution or agency representative) (hereinafter referred to as the institution or agency) pertains to the terms and conditions under which the Supplier agrees to give, and the Institution or
Agency agrees to accept, and to utilize Government of the United States of America Excess Properties (hereinafter called Excess Properties). ARTICLE I: To the extent that the Excess Properties are made available to the Supplier, and subject to the contingencies of the Supplier's program, the Supplier hereby approves the following allocation of Excess Properties to the Institution or Agency:
One ambulance
許躍薾 140.112.213.82
PROVIDED, however, that the Supplier reserves the right am privilege to amend, modify, reduce, suspend or cancel the allocation and delivery of Excess Prop- erties to the Institution or Agency, if the Supplier deems necessary, without prior consultation with, or the approval of, the Institution or Agency. ARTICLE II: The Institution or Agency hereby attests that it is, both in concept and practice, basically a non-profit institution; AND FURTHER, that it is charitable in nature, and that its purpose is to provide services to needy persons who could not otherwise obtain these services.
ARTICIE III: In accepting the Commodities, the Institution or Agency agrees fully and without reservation to the following conditions:
1. At no time and under no condition shall the Commodities, or any Part thereof, be sold, bartered, exchanged, or used as payment for goods and/or services.
2. Any fabrication of the Excess Properties into end-use products shall be accomplished by the Institution or Agency or its des gnated representative. Any and all costs incurred in this process shall be borne in their entirety by the Institution or Agency or by its sponsor (s).
228
Dodge Ambulance
國史饭 Academia Historica

(name of institution (hereinafter referred to as the Supplier) and the St. Camillus Hospital
located at 14 Hsute Road Makung Penghu

or agency) (address of institution or agency) as represented by Rev. Aldus Antonelli (name of institution or agency representative) (hereinafter referred to as the institution or agency) pertains to the terms and conditions under which the Supplier agrees to give, and the Institution or

Agency agrees to accept, and to utilize Government of the United States of America Excess Properties (hereinafter called Excess Properties). ARTICLE I: To the extent that the Excess Properties are made available to the Supplier, and subject to the contingencies of the Supplier's program, the Supplier hereby approves the following allocation of Excess Properties to the Institution or Agency:

PROVIDED, however, that the Supplier reserves the right am privilege to amend, modify, reduce, suspend or cancel the allocation and delivery of Excess Prop- erties to the Institution or Agency, if the Supplier deems necessary, without prior consultation with, or the approval of, the Institution or Agency. ARTICLE II: The Institution or Agency hereby attests that it is, both in concept and practice, basically a non-profit institution; AND FURTHER, that it is charitable in nature, and that its purpose is to provide services to needy persons who could not otherwise obtain these services.
ARTICIE III: In accepting the Commodities, the Institution or Agency agrees fully and without reservation to the following conditions:
1. At no time and under no condition shall the Commodities, or any Part thereof, be sold, bartered, exchanged, or used as payment for goods and/or services.

2. Any fabrication of the Excess Properties into end-use products shall be accomplished by the Institution or Agency or its des gnated representative. Any and all costs incurred in this process shall be borne in their entirety by the Institution or Agency or by its sponsor (s).
